member.name: IEnumExtraSearch.Clone
member.summary: Used to request a duplicate of the enumerator object to preserve its current state.
member.param: A pointer to the interface of a new enumerator object.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or a COM-defined error code otherwise.

member.name: IEnumExtraSearch.Next
member.summary: Used to request information on one or more search objects.
member.param: The number of search objects to be enumerated, starting from the current object. If celt is too large, the method should stop and return the actual number of search objects in pceltFetched.
A pointer to an array of pceltFetched structures containing information on the enumerated objects.
The number of objects actually enumerated. This may be less than celt.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or a COM-defined error code otherwise.

member.name: IEnumExtraSearch.Reset
member.summary: Used to reset the enumeration index to zero.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or a COM-defined error code otherwise.

member.name: IEnumExtraSearch.Skip
member.summary: Skip a specified number of objects.
member.param: The number of objects to skip.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or a COM-defined error code otherwise.

member.name: IEnumExtraSearch
member.summary: A standard OLE enumerator used by a client to determine the available search objects for a folder.
